intro: Zerna inermis, commonly known as the smooth zerna, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia, often found in moist meadows and along riverbanks. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided, giving it a delicate appearance. Zerna inermis is not commonly cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
